title: Strictly's Craig Revel Horwood insists Dev Griffin was right to leave
text:
Strictly’s Craig Revel Horwood insists Dev Griffin was right person to leave (Picture: Getty Images)

Strictly Come Dancing’s Craig Revel Horwood has insisted that Dev Griffin was the right person to leave.

Last week caused controversy when the radio presenter was booted off the competition, even though he was seemingly one of the strongest contestants on the show.

But despite the bold decision, the much-loved judge is still backing the choice to send Dev home.

Talking to Metro.co.uk ahead of the Best Heroes Awards, in London, the 54-year-old said: ‘Yes absolutely, professionally the right person to go.

‘If you asked me last week, I would have loved him to stay.’

Addressing the 34-year-old’s Street Commercial dance to Aladdin’s Friend Like Me, Craig gushed: ‘His blue routine, when he was the genie, was absolutely amazing!

He said the star failed on the night (Picture: BBC/Guy Levy)

‘But sadly, he failed on the night.’

He’s not the only judge to have commented on the shock results, as Shirley Ballas has also addressed the elimination drama.

Appearing on Loose Women earlier this week, she spoke about Dev’s professional dancing buddy, Dianne Buswell’s reaction – which saw her break down in tears on the ballroom floor.

‘[Dianne] puts life and soul into her partner,’ the 59-year-old explained: ‘So I understand why she was so upset.’

Shirley continued: ‘People need to get out there and vote, we do our job but as you can see there were people who were saved, who had a lot lower scores.’

Dianne has since addressed the results, where she revealed she felt as though she had let Dev down.

She wrote to her social media followers: ‘My heart is broken. this guy had so much to give and worked sooooo hard I’m so sorry your journey was cut short you have done me so proud, every week you would say you just didn’t want to let me down!

‘Dev you sooo didn’t you were a dream to teach and you were turning into such a great dancer thank you so much for everything.’

Dev also posted a similar message after the announcement, and declared: ‘It’s been incredible! I wish I could have stayed a bit longer but sadly my strictly ride has come to an end.

‘Thank you to all of the production team, wardrobe, makeup, crew, pro dancers and celebs for looking after me and being like family to me these past few weeks.

‘@diannebuswell you are the best! Thank you for being such an amazing partner and always pushing me to be the best version of myself.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues next Saturday on BBC One.
